page.title: 10COUNTRY PARK - ACTIVITIES
page.content: The Country Park hosts a number of sporting activities,including hang gliding, grass skiing,skiing and sledging in snowy winters like that of 1984-1985 and the annual Butser Run. The competitors in this event are sponsored to run (or walk) up and down the hill and the money raised is donated to local charities. A number of other events connected more with its 'country'role are organised each year.These include Sheepdog Trials and a large Country Fair held usually in July.As a number of local people own just one or a few sheep the Country Park also organises for them some of the important activities connected with the rearing of sheep,such as the statuatory dipping that has to be carried out,and shearing the sheep.
